meanings.definition: A stamp that is applied before the actual postage stamp on a piece of mail.
meanings.sent1: I placed the prestamps on the envelopes before adding the real stamps.
meanings.sent2: The prestamps were necessary for the mail to be delivered properly.
meanings.sent3: The prestamps made the envelopes look fancy before the real stamps were added.
meanings.sent4: The prestamps acted as a preview of the final postage on the mail.
meanings.sent5: The colorful prestamps stood out on the plain envelopes.

meanings.definition: To affix a stamp to mail before sending it.
meanings.sent1: She carefully prestamps each letter before dropping them in the mailbox.
meanings.sent2: Before mailing, remember to prestamps the envelopes.
meanings.sent3: He likes to prestamps his postcards with unique designs.
meanings.sent4: Prestamping the mail shows attention to detail.
meanings.sent5: Remember to prestamps the letters to ensure they reach their destination.

meanings.definition: The act of stamping mail before sending it.
meanings.sent1: Prestamps is an important step in preparing mail for delivery.
meanings.sent2: The prestamps process ensures the mail is properly handled.
meanings.sent3: The office has a dedicated area for prestamps to be applied.
meanings.sent4: Efficient prestamps can save time at the post office.
meanings.sent5: The clerk's quick prestamps impressed the customers waiting in line.
